abstract: Ben S. Bernanke said the Federal Reserve was “prepared to act as needed” to prevent market woes from spreading, while the Dow closed up nearly 250 points as investors went bargain-hunting.
snippet: Ben S. Bernanke said the Federal Reserve was “prepared to act as needed” to prevent market woes from spreading, while the Dow closed up nearly 250 points as investors went bargain-hunting.
lead_paragraph: The stock market recovered almost all of its losses from Tuesday’s sharp sell-off as investors went bargain-hunting yesterday at Wall Street’s equivalent of a late summer sale.

headline.main: Stocks Rally as Investors Chase Deals
headline.print_headline: Stocks Rally As Investors Chase Deals
